name: incaution
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality or fact of not showing or giving careful thought to the possible results: This is not the time for incaution and rash decisions. He was often frank to the point of incaution.
More examplesFewer examplesHis apparent incaution in a recent interview has been taken as a sign that he is about to quit.The country will now have to pay the price for the president's reckless incaution. He seems to have got carried away by uncharacteristic incaution in handling evidence.
